_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



At Contracted Operations-Louisville Packaging we are committed to operating and maintaining all of our processes (especially those using hazardous substances) in a safe and responsible manner. We use a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning programs to help ensure the safety of our employees and the public as well as the environment. 



2.0 Stationary Source and regulated Substances



The Louisville Packaging site blends and packages a variety of refrigerant gases. In our process, we use the following chemicals that EPA has identified as having the potential to cause significant offsite consequences in the event of a substantial accidental release.



Chemical---use of substance



Difluoroethane---Blending Operation

N-Butane/ ISOpentane---Blending Operation

Propane---Blending Operation and packaging

ISO-Butane---Blending Operation and packaging



NOTE: N-Butane will be received in a trailer containing a mix between N-Butane and ISO- Pentane. N-Butane makes up around 76% which is about 30,000 lbs. ISO-Pentane makes up around 24% which is close to the threshhold of 10,000 LBs. Even though the site currently does not exceed the threshold of 10,000 lbs for ISOpentane we included it in our RMP as a precautionary measure because it is very close to the threshold. Also, both N-Butane and ISO pentane come together as a mix, so when we used the RMP COMP we included both chemicals for both the worst case scenarios and the alternate release scenarios. 





3.0 General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps



Our company maintains a number of accident prevention programs, which implement specific prevention steps in order to ensure safe operation of all processes. The accident prevention programs in place are in compliance with OSHA's Process Safety Management (PSM) rule and EPA's Risk Management Program (RMP) rule. 



As par

t of our prevention efforts, we have implemented the following chemical-specific steps:



    -Operators trained on processes prior to start up    

        -all new or modified processes have pre-start up safety inspections

    -perform process hazard analysis on new and installed systems

    -materials installed pass quality assurance inspection

    -personnel turnover is controlled to maintain adequate experience and knowledge for safe operation

    -all processes inspected on a routine basis for mechanical integrity



4.0 Five-Year Accident History



There have been no accidents in the past five years with potential to cause significant onsite or offsite effects.



5.0 Emergency Response Program



We maintain an integrated contingency plan, which consolidates all of the various federal, state, and local regulatory requirements for emergency response planning. Our program provides the essential planning and training. Furthermore, we coordinate our plan with the following local agencies:



Fairdale Fire Department

Kentucky Emergency Response Plan

Louisville Jefferson County Emergency management Agency

Environmental Protection Agency 



6.0 Organization heirarchy for RMP implementation



Responsible for RMP implementation- Eric Wicker (Distribution Manager/ Environmental Affairs) (ph: 502-363-8035)

Resources for RMP implementation- Dave Morgan (Maintenance Senior Tech) (ph: 502-363-8033)

Responsible for PHA/ PHR/ PSSRs- Dave Harbaugh (Safety Coordinator) (ph: 502-363-8031)

Dave Morgan, Dave Harbaugh, and Eric Wicker report to Jason Hedden (Plant Manager) (ph: 502-363-8027)            



On 11-6-18 this RMP was updated due to the business acquiring ICOR International from Indianapolis. Because of this the site will handle a few new products and will be required to keep ISO-Butane and Propane on site in larger quantities that will exceed the threshold.  

                                                     



7.0 Certifications



To the Best of my knowledge, info

rmation, and belief formed after reasonable inquiry, the information submitted is true, accurate, and complete.



William Eric Wicker

Distribution Manager/ Environmental affairs

November 6th, 2018
